Speaker: saavik's voice
Dialogue: Captain's log. Stardate 8130.3, Starship Enterprise on training mission to Gamma Hydra. Section 14, coordinates 22/87/4. Approaching Neutral Zone, all systems functioning.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Leaving Section Fourteen for Section Fifteen.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Project parabolic course to avoid entering Neutral Zone.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Captain... I'm getting something on the distress channel. Minimal signal... But something...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Can you amplify?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: I'm trying...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Course change projected.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: It's an emergency distress call!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: On speakers!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: ... and many casualties.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: This is the Starship Enterprise. Your message is breaking up. Give your coordinates. Repeat --

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Enterprise, our position is Gamma Hydra, Section Ten...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: In the neutral zone.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Hull penetrated, life support systems failing. Can you assist us, Enterprise? Can you...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Data on Kobayashi Maru! Tactical!

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Subject vessel is third class neutronic fuel carrier, crew of eighty-one, three hundred passengers.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Damn.  Mr. Sulu, plot an intercept course.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: May I remind the Captain that if a Starship enters the zone --

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: I'm aware of my responsibilities, Mister.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: ... Now entering the Neutral Zone...

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Warning. We have entered the Neutral Zone... Warning...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Estimating two minutes to intercept.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Stand by transporter room, ready to beam survivors, aboard.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Captain, I've lost their signal!

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Alert. Sensors indicate three Klingon Cruisers, bearing 316, mark 4, closing fast.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Visual!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Battle stations! Activate shields!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Shields activated!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Inform the Klingons we are on a rescue mission...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: They're jamming all frequencies, Captain --

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Klingons on attack course and closing.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: We're over our heads. Mr. Sulu, get us out of here.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: I'll try, Captain.

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Klingon cruisers approaching,

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Visual!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Evasive action!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Engineering! damage report!

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: Main energizer hit, Captain!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Engage auxiliary power. Prepare to return fire!

Speaker: a cadet
Dialogue: Shields collapsing, Captain!

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: Captain, we're losing auxiliary power!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Fire all phasers...!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: No power to the weapons system, sir.

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: Captain, it's no use. We're dead in space.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Activate escape pods. Send out the Log Buoy... All hands abandon ship. Repeat -- all hands --

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: All right, open her up.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Any suggestions, Admiral?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Prayer, Mr. Saavik. The Klingons do not take prisoners.  Captain.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Trainees to the briefing room.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Physician, heal thyself.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: That's all you have to say?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'm not a drama critic.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Well, Mr. Saavik, are you going to stay with the sinking ship?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Permission to speak candidly, sir?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Very well.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: I don't believe this was a fair test of my command capabilities.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And why not?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Because... there was no way to win.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: A no-win situation is a possibility every commander may face. Has that never occurred to you?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: ... No, sir. It has not.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: How we deal with death is at least as important as how we deal with life, wouldn't you say?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: As I indicated, Admiral, that thought had not occurred to me.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Then you have something new to think about. Carry on.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Wouldn't it be easier to put an experienced crew back on the ship?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They'll learn. Galloping about the cosmos is a game for the young, doctor.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: What is that supposed to mean?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Aren't you dead?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I assume you are loitering here to learn what efficiency rating I plan to give your cadets.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I am understandably curious.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They destroyed the simulator room and you with it.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The Kobayshi Maru scenario frequently wreaks havoc with students and equipment.  As I recall you took the test three times yourself. Your final solution was, shall we say, unique?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: It had the virtue of never having been tried.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Yours was not a solution which would have occurred to a Vulcan mentality.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: So you said at the time. Speaking of which, your protg's first rare -- a trifle emotional --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: She's half Romulan, Jim. The admixture makes her more volatile than -- me, for example.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Than you. Yes, I see that. By the way, thank you for this.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I know of your fondness for antiques.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...' Message, Spock?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: None of which I am consciously aware -- except, of course, happy birthday -- surely the best of times.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hrummm... and where are you off to, now?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The Enterprise. I must check in before your inspection. And you?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Home.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Something oppresses you.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Something.

Speaker: chekov's voice
Dialogue: Starship log, Stardate 8130.4. This report classified MOST SECRET. Log Entry by Commander Pavel Chekov, Duty Officer. Starship USS Reliant on orbital approach with Ceti Alpha VI in connection with project code name GENESIS. We are continuing our search for a lifeless planet which will serve as a suitable test site for the Genesis Experiments. This is the 16th planet we have visited, so far, no success.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Standard orbit, Mr. Beach.

Speaker: beach
Dialogue: Standard orbit, sir.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Any change in surface scan?

Speaker: beach
Dialogue: Negative. Limited atmosphere, dominated by craylon gas, sand and high velocity winds. Incapable of supporting life forms.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Does it have to be completely lifeless?

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Don't tell me you've got something.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: We've picked up a minor energy flux reading on one dyno scanner.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Damn! Are you sure? Maybe the scanner's out of adjustment --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: I suppose it could be a particle of preanimate matter caught in the matrix...

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: All right, let's get on the Comm-pic to Doctor Marcus. Maybe it's something we can transplant.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: You know what she'll say...

Speaker: carol marcus's voice
Dialogue: Something you can transplant? I don't know --

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: It might only be a particle of preanimate matter...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Then again it might not. You boys have to be clear on this: there can't be so much as a microbe or the show's off.  Why don't you have a look? If it IS something that can be moved...

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: You bet, doctor. We're on our way!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: How can you let them pull that stuff on you? They're just lazy.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: And bored. I know. But maybe it IS something they can...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Come on, Mother, that's just the military mentality. Never put off tomorrow what you can put off today. If there's one atom of life...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I know, I know...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Well, don't have kittens. Genesis is going to work. They'll remember  you in a wreath with Newton, Einstein, Surak...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Thanks a lot. No respect from my offspring --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Par for the course... you teaming up with me for bridge after dinner?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Maybe...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Every time we have dealings with Starfleet, I get nervous.  We're dealing with something that COULD be perverted into a dreadful weapon. Remember that overgrown boy scout you used to hang out with? That's exactly the --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Listen, kiddo, Jim Kirk was many things, but he was never a Boy Scout...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Come.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bless me, doctor; and what beams you into this neck of the woods?

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: 'Beware Romulans bearing gifts.' Happy Birthday...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Romulan Ale! Bones, you know this stuff is illegal --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: I only use it for medicinal purposes. Don't be a pring...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Twenty-two, eighty-three...

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Takes the stuff a while to ferment. Gimme.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Now open the other one.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'm almost afraid to. What did you bring me, contraband Klingon --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: More antiques for your collection -- Cheers!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Cheers. Bones, these are... charming.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Four hundred years old. You don't find many with the lens still intact.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uh -- what are they?

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: For your eyes. For most patients of your age, I generally administer Retlax Five to restore flexibility of the lens.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: But I'm allergic to Retlax.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Exactly. Happy birthday.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Slide them down your nose. Now look at me over the top. And you read printed matter through the bottom.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Amazing! I don't know what to say --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Say thank you.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Damn it, Jim, what the hell's the matter? Other people have birthdays. Why're we treating yours like a funeral?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bones, I don't want to be lectured.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: What DO you want? Damn it, why isn't there a girl here? You know this has nothing to do with age. This is about you flying a goddamn computer console when you wanna be out hopping Galaxies.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spare me your notions of poetry, please. We all have our assigned duties and...

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Bull. You're hiding -- hiding behind the rules and regulations --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And who am I hiding from?

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: From yourself, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Don't mince words, Bones; tell me what you really think.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: I'm your doctor and I'm your friend, Jim. Get back your command. Get it back before you really do grow old. Before you turn into part of this collection.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Are you sure these are the coordinates?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Captain, this is the garden spot of Ceti Alpha VI --

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: I can hardly see --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: There's nothing, let's go --

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: They look like cargo carriers...

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: A face! I saw -- it was like a child --

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: You're crazy -- !

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: I saw it -- !

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: There's an air-lock.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: There's breathable atmosphere in here.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: What the hell is this? Did they crash? Where's the rest of the ship?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: I told you! I told you I saw a --

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Ssssh!

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Botany Bay -- oh no!

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: What's the matter -- ?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Captain, we've got to get out of here -- now! Damn! Hurry!

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: But the child --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Never mind! Hurry!

Speaker: beach
Dialogue: Try again.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Starship Reliant to Captain Terrell ... This is Lieutenant Kyle. Will you please respond, Captain... Captain Terrell, respond please.

Speaker: beach
Dialogue: Let's give them a little more time.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Khan!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: I never thought to see your face again.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Chekov, who is this man?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: A criminal, Captain -- a product of the late 20th Century genetic engineering --

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: What do you want with us? I demand --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: You are in a position to demand nothing, sir. I, on the other hand, am in a position to grant nothing. What you see is all that remains of the ship's company and the crew of the Botany Bay, marooned here fifteen years ago by Captain James T. Kirk.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Listen to me -- you men and women --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Save your strength, Captain, these people have sworn to live and die at my command two hundred years before you were born. Do you mean he...  ... never told you the tale? To amuse you, Captain? Never told you how the Enterprise picked up the Botany Bay, lost in space from the year 1996, myself and the ship's company in cryogenic freeze?

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: I've never even met Admiral Kirk --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Admiral? He didn't tell you how Admiral Kirk sent seventy of us into exile on this barren sand heap with only the contents of these cargo bays to sustain us?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: You lie! On Ceti Alpha V there was life, a fair chance to --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: This is Ceti Alpha V! Ceti Alpha VI exploded six months after we were left here. The shock shifted the orbit of this planet and everything was laid waste. Admiral Kirk never bothered to check on our progress. It was only the fact of my genetically engineered intellect that enabled us to survive! On earth, two hundred years ago, I was a prince, with power over millions -- now, like Prometheus I have been left by Admiral Kirk to digest my own entrails.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Captain Kirk was your host! You repaid his hospitality by trying to steal his ship and murder him.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: And I'll wager he never told you about his shipmate, the beautiful and courageous Lieutenant McGiver, who gave up everything to join me in exile. OUT OF LOVE. And see how Admiral Kirk requited her devotion -- She's dead as earth!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: A plague upon you all.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: You didn't expect to find me. You thought this was Ceti Alpha VI. Why are you here?

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: No matter.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: You will soon tell me willingly enough.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Let me introduce you to Ceti Alpha V's only remaining indigenous life form; what do you think? They've killed twenty of my people, including my beloved wife. Oh, not all at once and not instantly, to be sure. Their young enter through the ears and wrap themselves around the cerebral cortex. This has the effect of rendering the victim extremely susceptible to suggestion. Later, as they grow, follows madness, paralysis -- and death. These are pets, of course -- not quite domesticated.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Khan, listen to me! Captain Kirk was only doing his duty! You --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: There is some pain at first, I am told, and then the effects are quite benign -- until the end. That was what I learned from watching my wife.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: That's better! Now: tell me why you are here -- and tell me where I may find James Kirk.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Captain Terrell. Captain Terrell... This is Reliant; please respond.

Speaker: beach
Dialogue: Mr. Kyle, muster a landing party with full arms. Alert the transporter room. We're beaming down.

Speaker: terrell's voice
Dialogue: Reliant, this is Terrell. Respond please.

Speaker: beach
Dialogue: This is Reliant. Clark, are you all right?

Speaker: terrell's voice
Dialogue: Everything's fine, commander. I'll explain when I see you. Oh, by the way, we're bringing several guests aboard. Prepare to beam up on my next signal. Terrell out.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Guests?

Speaker: beach
Dialogue: Maybe we ARE transplanting something.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Enterprise, this is Admiral Kirk's party on final approach.

Speaker: enterprise voice
Dialogue: Enterprise welcomes you. Prepare for docking.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I really must thank you.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: I am delighted; any chance to go aboard Enterprise, however briefly, is always an excuse for nostalgia.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I cut your new orders personally. By the end of the month, you'll have your first command: USS EXCELSIOR.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Thank you, sir. I've looked forward to this for a long time.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You've earned it. But I'm still grateful to have you at the helm for three weeks. I don't believe these kids can steer.

Speaker: intercom voice
Dialogue: Docking procedure complete.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Prepare for Admiral's inspection.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Open the Air Lock.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Permission to come aboard, Captain?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Welcome aboard, Admiral. I believe you know my trainee crew. Certainly they have come to know you.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yes, we've been through death and life together.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Scott, you old space dog. You're well?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: I had me a wee bout -- but Dr. McCoy pulled me through.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Oh? A wee bout of what, Mr. Scott?

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Shore leave, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Ah.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And who is this?

Speaker: preston
Dialogue: Midshipman First Class Peter Preston, engineers mate, SIR.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Your first training voyage, Mr. Preston?

Speaker: preston
Dialogue: Yes, SIR.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I see. Well, shall we start with the engine room?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: I believe you'll find all in order --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: We'll see you on the bridge, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Very good, Mr. Spock.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: He's not what I expected, Sir.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: What did you expect, Lieutenant?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: He's very human.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: We can't all be perfect, Saavik. You must control your prejudices and remember that as a Vulcan as well as a Romulan you are forever a stranger in an alien land. Around you are humans, and as a member of the Starfleet you are unlikely ever to escape their presence or their influence. You must learn to tolerance in addition to all else I have taught you. Tolerance is logical.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: As always, my mentor. Company dismiss.

Speaker: preston
Dialogue: I believe you'll find everything shipshape, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Oh do you? Have you any idea, Midshipman Preston, how many times I've had to listen to Mr. Scott on the Comm, telling me his troubles? Have you any idea the ribbing I've had to endure in the officers' mess to the effect that the Enterprise is a flying death trap?

Speaker: preston
Dialogue: Oh, no, sir! This is the finest engine room in the whole Star --

Speaker: preston
Dialogue: If the Admiral can't see the facts for himself, then, with all due respect, he's as blind as a Tiberion bat. SIR.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Midshipman, you're a tiger.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: My sister's youngest, Admiral. Crazy to get to space.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Every young boy's fancy. I seem to remember it myself.  Very well. Mr. Scott, are your engines capable of handling a minor training cruise?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Give the word, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Scott, the word is given.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: What about the rest of the inspection, Admiral?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The inspection will continue once we're underway, Doctor.

Speaker: intercom voice
Dialogue: This is Starfleet operations. Enterprise is cleared for departure.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Admiral on the bridge!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Very well, Mr. Saavik, clear all moorings.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: All moorings are clear, Captain.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Thank you, Mr. Saavik.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Lieutenant, how many times have you piloted a Starship out of Spacedock?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Never, sir.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Take her out, Mr. Saavik.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: There's a first time for everything, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: To be sure, Captain.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aft thrusters, Mr. Sulu.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Aft thrusters, sir.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Ahead one quarter impulse power.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Would you like a tranquilizer?

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Ahead one quarter impulse power.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: We are clear and free to navigate.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Course heading, Captain?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Captain's discretion.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Mr. Sulu, you may follow your nose.

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Steady on course. All systems normal.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: It's not much different from Enterprise.  When I was a guest aboard her some years ago, Captain Kirk kindly allowed me to memorize her technical manuals. And now, Mr. Chekov, let us review: You say you have no details of Project 'Genesis' ?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Beyond what I told you, sir, it is classified information.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Umm. And would Admiral Kirk have access to such information?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: I would think so, sir. He's on the Fleet General Staff.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Then to whom do you report directly regarding Genesis?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: To Doctor Marcus, the civilian director of the experiments on Space Laboratory Regula I.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: I see. Helmsman?

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: May I speak? We're all with you, sir, but consider: we are free, we have a ship and the means to go where we will. We have escaped permanent exile on Ceti Alpha V. You have proved your superior intellect and defeated the plans of Admiral Kirk. You do not need to defeat him again.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: He tasks me -- and I'll have him. I'll chase him round the moons of Nibia and round the Antares maelstrom and round perdition's flames before I give him up.  Prepare to alter course -- for Space Station Regula I.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Does that about do it?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I don't think there's another piece of information we could squeeze into the memory banks. Next time, we'll design a bigger one.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Who --

Speaker: jedda
Dialogue: Comm-Pic coming in on hyperchannel ... It's Reliant.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: On the screen, please, Jedda.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: ... come in, please. This is Reliant calling Regula I. Repeat. This is USS Reliant --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Commander, we are receiving. This is Regula I. Go ahead.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Dr. Marcus... good. We're en route to you and should be there in three days.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: En route? Why? We weren't expecting you for another three months. Has something happened?  Has something happened? Do you read us?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: All went well. Nothing has happened. Ceti Alpha VI has checked out.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I still don't under --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: We have received new orders. Upon our arrival at Regula I, all materials of Project Genesis will be transferred to this ship for immediate testing at Ceti Alpha VI.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Will you please be quiet!  Commander Chekov, this is completely irregular. Who gave the order you are quoting? Who gave the order?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: The order comes from Starfleet command, Dr. Marcus, direct from the General Staff.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: But Genesis is a civilian project, under my control --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: I have my orders.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Pin him down, mother! Who gave the orders!?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: The orders come from Admiral James T. Kirk.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I knew it! I knew it! All along the military has wanted to get their hands on this --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: This is completely improper, Commander Chekov. I have no intention of allowing Reliant or any other unauthorized personnel access to our work or materials.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: I'm sorry you feel that way, Doctor. Admiral Kirk's orders are confirmed. Please prepare to deliver Genesis to us upon our arrival. Reliant out.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Commander Chekov -- !

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Well done, Commander.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: You realize, sir, that they will attempt to contact Admiral Kirk and confirm the order.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Will you please be quiet! We must have order here.  This has to be some sort of mistake.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Mistake? We're all alone here. They waited until everyone was on shift-leave to do this. Reliant is supposed to be at our disposal, not vice-versa.

Speaker: madison
Dialogue: It seems clear that Starfleet never intended that --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I know, but --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I've tried to warn you. Scientists are always pawns of the military --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Starfleet has kept the peace for a hundred years, I cannot and will not subscribe to your interpretation of this event.

Speaker: jedda
Dialogue: You may be right, Doctor, but what about Reliant? She's on her way.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Get your gear together where it's handy.

Speaker: march
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: That's for us to know and Reliant to find out. We have only three days. Let's not waste time.

Speaker: saavik's voice
Dialogue: Hold please -- !

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Lieutenant, are you wearing your hair differently?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: It is still regulation, Admiral.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: May I speak, sir?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Lieutenant, self-expression does not seem to be one of your problems.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: I wish to thank you for the high efficiency rating.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You earned it.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: I did not think so.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You're bothered by your performance on the Kobayashi Maru.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: I failed to resolve the situation.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: There is no correct resolution. It is a test of character.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: May I ask how you dealt with the test?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You may ask, Lieutenant.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That was a little joke.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Humor... that is a difficult concept ... it is not logical...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We learn by doing, Lieutenant.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You want my advice?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Take the test again.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Who's been holding up the damn elevator?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Has she changed her hairstyle?

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Wonderful stuff, that Romulan ale --

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Admiral Kirk --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Kirk here.

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: I have an urgent CommPic from Space Lab Regula I for the Admiral. Dr. Carol Marcus.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: In my quarters, Uhura.

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: It never rains but when it pours --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: As a physician you of all people should appreciate the danger of re-opening old wounds.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uhura. Can't you augment?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: I'm trying, sir. Stand by...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Jim... read me? Can you read me?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Message breaking up, Carol. What's wrong? What's wrong?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: ... Can't read you... repeat...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Repeat... what's wrong? What's wrong?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: ... taking Genesis away from us...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Taking Genesis? Who? Who is taking Genesis?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: ... see you but can't hear. Did you... order...?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What order? Who's taking Genesis?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: ... Please help us, Jim... won't let them have... without proper... repeat... on whose authority...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Carol!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Jim please --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uhura! What's happening? Damn it...

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Transmission jammed at the source, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Damn. Alert Starfleet Headquarters. I want to talk with Starfleet Command.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Stop engines.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Stop engines.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: An emergency situation has arisen. By order of Starfleet Command, as of now, 1800 hours, I am assuming command of this vessel. Duty officer so note in the ship's log. Plot a new course: for Space Laboratory Regula I.  Mr. Scott?

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We'll be going to warp speed --

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: Aye, sir --

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Course plotted for Regula I, Admiral...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engage warp engines --

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Prepare for warp speed.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Ready, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We've got a problem.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Something may be wrong at Regula I. We've been ordered to investigate.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Regula I is a scientific research laboratory, if memory serves...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I told Starfleet all we had was a boatload of children but we're the only ship in the quadrant. Spock: those cadets of yours -- how good are they? How will they respond under real pressure?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Like all living beings, Admiral each according to his gifts. The ship is yours.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That won't be necessary: just take me to Regula I.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Excuse my presumption, but I do not agree. As a teacher on a training mission, I am content to command a Starship. If we are to go on actual duty, it is clear that the senior officer aboard must assume command.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: But it may be nothing; garbled communications. Why don't you...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: You proceed from a false assumption. I am a Vulcan. I have no ego to bruise.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You are going to remind me that logic alone dictates your actions.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I was going to remind you of nothing, least of all that which you know well.  Your mistake, if I may be so bold, was promotion. Commanding a Starship is your first best destiny. Anything else is a waste of material.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I would not presume to debate you.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: That is wise. In any case, were I to invoke logic, logic clearly dictates that the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Or the one.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: You are my superior officer. You are also my friend. I have been and always shall be yours.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Will you accompany me to the bridge?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I'd best talk with Mr. Scott, first so that he may, in his own words, explain the situation to his cadets.

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Regula I, this is Enterprise. This is Enterprise calling. Do you receive... I say...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: ... Again, this is Enterprise calling Space Lab Regula I. Come in, please. Dr. Marcus. Please respond, please -- it's no use; no response from Regula I.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: But no longer jammed?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: No, sir. No nothing.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: There are two possibilities, sir they are unwilling to respond, they are unable to respond.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: How far?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Twelve hours and forty-three minutes, present speed.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Give up Genesis, she said. What in God's name does that mean? Give it up to whom?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: It might help my analysis if I knew what Genesis was.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uhura, ask Dr. McCoy to join us in my quarters. Mr. Saavik, take the con.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: I've got the sick bay ready. Will someone please tell me what is going on?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Computer. Request security procedure and access to Project Genesis Summary.

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Identify for retina scan.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Kirk, Admiral James T., Starfleet

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Summary, please.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Carol Marcus --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I'm Dr. Carol Marcus, and I am the director of the Project Genesis team at Regula I. What exactly IS Genesis? Put simply, Genesis is a procedure whereby the molecular structure of any given matter can be restructured -- changed -- into anything else of identical mass.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Fascinating.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Wait --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Stage One of our experiments was conducted in the labora- tory. Stage Two of the series will be attempted in a lifeless underground; Stage Three will involve the process on a plane- tary scale. What follows is a computer projected simulation of Stage Three. Please watch closely.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: -- Unleashing, almost instantan- eously, what we call the Genesis effect. Particulate matter is reorganized and electrified -- with life introduced results. Instead of a dead moon, a living breathing planet, capable of sus- taining whatever life forms we see fit to deposit on it... The reformed object you see represents the merest fraction of the Genesis potential, should the Federation wish to pursue these experiments to their logical conclusion.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: When we consider the problems of population and food supply, the usefulness of this process begins to become clear. This concludes this demonstration tape. Thank you for your attention. The Genesis team eagerly awaits the decision of the Federation regarding the next phase of our work.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: It literally is Genesis...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The power of creation --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Have they proceeded with their experiments?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The tape was made a year ago. I can only assume they've reached Phase Two by now --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: But dear Lord, are we intelligent enough to -- Suppose, this thing were used where life already exists?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: It would destroy such life in favor of its new matrix --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: It's new -- have you any idea what you're saying?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I was not attempting to evaluate its moral implications, Doctor. As a matter of cosmic history, it has always been easier to destroy than to create --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Not anymore! Now you can do both at the same time! According to myth, the earth was created in six days. Watch out: here comes Genesis; we'll do it for you in six minutes --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I don't dispute that in the wrong hands --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Would you like to tell me whose are the right hands, my cold-blooded friend? Are you in favor of these experiments?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Gentlemen, this isn't --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Really, Dr. McCoy; you cannot ban the acquisition of knowledge because you distrust the moral implications of what you learn. Logic suggests --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Logic?? We're talking about universal Armageddon, you inhuman bloodless...

Speaker: saavik's voice
Dialogue: Admiral, sensors indicate a vessel in our area, closing fast.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What do you make of her?

Speaker: saavik's voice
Dialogue: It's one of ours, Admiral... It's Reliant.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: What's she doing here?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Chekov's on Reliant, isn't he?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: She's not responding...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Try the emergency channels...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Enterprise to Reliant. Come in, Reliant.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Picture, Mr. Saavik.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Attempt visual communication.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Is it possible their COMM system has failed -- ?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: It would explain a great many things --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Slow to one-half impulse power. Let's be friends...

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: Slowing to one-half impulse.

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: They're requesting visual communications, sir.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Let them eat static.

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: They're still running with shields down.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Of course. We're one big happy fleet. Ah, Kirk, my old friend, do you know the Klingon proverb that tells us revenge is a dish that is best served cold?  It is very cold in space.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Reliant in our section this quadrant, sir, and slowing --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Visual.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Sir, may I quote General Order 12: 'On the approach of any vessel, when communications have not been est --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Lieutenant, the Admiral is aware of the Regulations.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yellow alert.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Energize defense fields.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: I'm getting a voice message... wait ... short range band. They say their Chambers coil is shorting their COMM system.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Scanning...

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: They still haven't raised their shields.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Careful: Not all at once. The engine room. Lock on target and prepare to fire.

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Locking phasers on target.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Their coil emissions are normal... Wait: their shields are going up. They're locking phasers -- !

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Raise shields! Energize phasers, stand by to --

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Respirators! Get back! Use your respirators!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Sulu... The shields!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Trying, sir!

Speaker: intercom voice
Dialogue: Medical Alert: Engine Room.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: I can't get power, sir!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Scotty!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uhura, turn off those damn channels!!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Mr. Scott on discrete.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Scotty, let's have it.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Just hanging on, sir. Main energizers out.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: They knew just where to hit us.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: WHO? Who knew just where to hit us? And why?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: One thing is certain; we cannot escape on auxiliary power.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Visual!  Mr. Sulu, divert everything to the phasers --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Too late --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hang on!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Scotty -- what's left?

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: Just the batteries, sir. I can have auxiliary power in a few minutes --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We don't have minutes. Can you give me phaser power?

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: A few shots, sir.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Not enough against their shields.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Who the hell are they?

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Admiral... Commander Reliant is signaling.  He wishes to discuss terms of our surrender.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: On screen.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Admiral --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Do it, while we have time.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Khan!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: You still remember, Admiral. I cannot help but be touched. Of course, I remember you.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What is the meaning of this attack? Where is the crew of the Reliant?

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Surely I have made my meaning plain. I mean to avenge myself upon you, Admiral. I've deprived your ship of power and when I swing round I mean to deprive you of your life --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: -- But I wanted you to know first who it was who had beaten you: I, Khan Noonian Singh, the eagle you attempted to cage forever.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Khan, listen to me -- if its me you want, I'll have myself beamed aboard. All I ask is that you spare my crew.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: That is a most intriguing offer. Typical, I must say of your sterling character. Let me think.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: I make you a counter-proposal, I will agree to your terms, if in addition to yourself, you turn over to me all data and material regarding the project called Genesis.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Genesis, what's that?

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Don't play with me, Kirk, my hand is on the phaser control --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Give me some time to recall the data on our computers --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: I give you sixty seconds, Admiral.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Admiral, you can't give him Genesis...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: At least we know he hasn't got it. Just keep nodding as though I'm giving orders. Saavik, punch up the data charts of Reliant's command console -- hurry...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Reliant's command...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: HURRY.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The prefix code?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: It's all we've got.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: On screen...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Please, please -- you've got to give us time -- the bridge is smashed, computers inoperative...

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Time is a luxury you do not have, Admiral: forty-five seconds...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: I don't understand --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You've got to learn WHY things work on a Starship.  It's coming through now, Khan...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The prefix code is 16309. All commands from each Starship bridge are relayed electronically; each ship has its own prefix combination code...

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Thirty seconds...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: ... to prevent an enemy from doing just what we're attempting; using our console to tap in a message, an order to lower Reliant's damn shields...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Let's hope he hasn't changed the combination. He's quite intelligent...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Wait for my signal, Spock -- too soon and he'll have time to figure it out and raise them again.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Khan, how do I know you'll keep your word?

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: I've given you no word to keep, Admiral. In my judgment, you simply have no alternative.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I take your point. Stand by to receive our transmission.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Sulu, lock phasers on target and await my command...

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Phasers locked...

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Time's up, Admiral...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Here it comes. Now, Spock.

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Sir -- our shields are dropping!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Raise them --

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: They won't --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Where's the over-ride??

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: FIRE!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: At them! At them! FIRE! FIRE! Why can't you?

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: We can't fire, sir; they've damaged the photon controls and the warp drive. We must withdraw!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Sir, we must!  We must repair the damage. Enterprise will wait; she's not going anywhere.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Sir, you did it.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I did nothing -- except get caught with my britches down. I must be senile. Mr. Saavik, you just keep right on quoting regulations. Meantime, let's find out what the hell is going on and see how bad we've been --

Speaker: crew chief
Dialogue: Hit your blowers!

Speaker: preston
Dialogue: Is the word given?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: The word is given: warp speed.

Speaker: preston
Dialogue: Aye...

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: WHY?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: He wants to kill me for passing sentence on him 14 years ago -- and he doesn't care who stands between him and his vengeance.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Scotty, I'm sorry...

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: He stayed at his post. When the trainees ran, he stayed.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: If he hadn't, we'd be space by now.

Speaker: spock's voice
Dialogue: Admiral, this is Spock.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yes, Spock.

Speaker: spock's voice
Dialogue: Engine room reports auxiliary power restored. We can proceed at impulse power.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Best speed to Regula I. Kirk out. Scotty, I've got to ask: Any chance of getting the mains back on the line?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: I dinna think so, sir, but you'll have my best --

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Thanks -- I know you tried, Doctor...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Are you all right?

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Doctors lose patients sometimes. Damn. I'm still in the dark: How'd he know about Genesis?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: At the moment that question takes a back seat to preventing him from laying his hands on it. You said it yourself; we're talking about a bang that would re-arrange the universe...

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: There may still be time... you gave as good as you got.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I got beat. We're only alive because I knew something about these ships that he didn't.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Try again.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Space Station Regular I, this is Starship Enterprise. Come in, please...

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: I say again. Space Station Regular. This is Starship Enterprise. Please respond. Please respond.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: ... No response, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Sensors, Captain?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Scanners and sensors still inoperative. There's no way to tell what's  inside the station.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And no way of knowing if Reliant is still in the area...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Affirmative, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: ... Blind as a Tiberian Bat. What do you make of the plantoid beyond?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Regula is class "D'. It consists of various remarkable ores. Essentially, a great rock in space.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Reliant could be hiding behind that rock.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: A distinct possibility.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engine room... Scotty, do we have enough power for the transporters?

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: Just barely, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'm going down to the station.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Khan could be down there!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: He's BEEN there and hasn't found what he wants. Can you spare someone? There may be people hurt.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: I can spare me...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Begging the Admiral's pardon: General Order 15: 'No  flag officer shall beam into a hazardous area without armed escort.'

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: There is no such regulation.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: All right, join the party. Mr. Spock, the ship is yours.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Aye sir --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Establish a parking orbit around the station and send me a complete damage report when you've talked with Mr. Scott.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Be careful, Jim...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hello...! Anybody here?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Indeterminate life signs.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Phasers on stun. Move out.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They even killed the galley chief.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: This one looks like a Steward. They're not warm, but rigor hasn't set in. This didn't happen all that long ago, Jim.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Carol...

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Admiral Kirk, Enterprise. Come in, please. Come in please.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: My God!

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: That's Clark Terrell, Jim, I've served with him.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Brain disturbance. Appears to be drug induced.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Saavik, for God's sake, tell her we're all right.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: I say again. This is Enterprise. Please acknowledge signal. Please --

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Commander Uhura, this is Lt. Saavik. We're all right. Please stand by. Out.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Aye, aye.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Oh, God, Admiral...!

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: It's Dr. McCoy, Captain. Do you remember me?

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: McCoy? Yes. Oh, yes.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Oh, sir. It was Khan! We found him on Ceti Alpha V.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Easy, Pavel... Tell me what you can...

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: No life signs -- but he was there. Captured us. He -- he put creatures in our bodies. To control our minds.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: It's all right, you're safe...

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: ... Made us say -- lies... Do... things... But we beat him... The Captain and me. -- He thought he controlled us, but he didn't ... The Captain was strong.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Captain. Where is Dr. Marcus? Where are the Genesis materials?

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: He couldn't find them. Some of the scientists were still here, but everything else, even the data banks -- were empty.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: That's true, Admiral. All the memory cells have been emptied.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Erased...

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: He tortured those people. None of them would tell him anything. He went wild, strung them up and slit their throats. He wanted to tear the place apart, but he was late: he had to get back to Reliant in time to blow you to bits.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: He came damn close...

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: He left us.  We were no longer of use. SAAVIK Where is  the Reliant crew? Dead?

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Marooned on Ceti Alpha V. He's completely mad, Admiral. He blames you for the death of his wife...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I know what he blames me for.  Where's the transporter room?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Did he make it down here?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: It was not my impression. He spent most of his time trying to wring the information out of the people.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Anything?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Somebody left the unit on. If everyone else was dead, it implies that no one remained to turn it off. Those people back there bought escape time for Genesis with their lives.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: It doesn't make sense. These coordinates are well within Regula -- a plantoid we know to be lifeless and airless.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: If Stage Two was completed, it was underground -- she said it was going to be underground.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Stage Two of what?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Kirk to Enterprise. Damage report, Spock?

Speaker: spock's voice
Dialogue: Admiral, if we go by the book, like Lieutenant Saavik, hours could seem like days.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I read you, Captain. Let's have it.

Speaker: spock's voice
Dialogue: The situation is grave, Admiral. We won't have main power for six days at least. Auxiliary power has temporarily failed, but maybe we can restore that in two days. By the book, Admiral.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Meaning you can't even beam us back?

Speaker: spock's voice
Dialogue: Not at present.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Captain Spock, if you do not hear from us within one hour your orders are to restore what power you can, take the Enterprise to the nearest Star Base and alert Starfleet command when you are out of jamming range.

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Sir -- we won't leave you behind...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uhura, if you don't hear from us, there won't be anybody behind. Kirk out.  You gentleman can remain here, or...

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: If it's all the same, Admiral, we'd like to share the risk.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Very well. Let's go.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Go? Where are we going?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Where they went. Saavik.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: But what if they went -- nowhere?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Then this will be your big chance to get away from it all.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Ready.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Admiral --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Genesis, I presume.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: You're the sonavabitch who committed mass murder up there.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'm Admiral Kirk...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: We were still there, you dumb bastard! We could hear the screams all the way to the transporter room --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Where's Dr. Marcus --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I'm Doctor Marcus!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: David --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Mother, go back!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Jim --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Go back. I'm going to kill him.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: You do that and you'll have murdered your father.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: I'll hold onto this.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: You've got a little grey --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Carol. Is that true?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: She's making it up! My father was Professor --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: David, you're just making this harder --

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: I'm afraid it's even harder than you think, Doctor.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Please don't move --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Chekov -- !

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Admiral.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Your excellency, have you been listening?

Speaker: khan's voice
Dialogue: I have indeed, Captain. You have done well...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I knew it -- !

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Don't move -- any of you!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Captain... We're waiting. What's the delay?

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: All is well, sir. You have the coordinates to beam up Genesis...

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: First things first, Captain. Kill Admiral Kirk.

Speaker: terrell
Dialogue: Excellency... it is difficult. I try to obey, but --

Speaker: khan's voice
Dialogue: Kill him.

Speaker: khan's voice
Dialogue: Kill him, Terrell. Now.

Speaker: khan's voice
Dialogue: Terrell? Chekov -- !

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Jim -- for God's sake!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Khan, you bloodsucker, they're finished! You'll have to do your own dirty work now. Do you hear me? Do you?

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Kirk! Kirk, you are still alive -- my old friend...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Still, 'old friend.' You've managed to kill just about everyone else, but like a poor marksman, you keep missing the target.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Perhaps I no longer need to try.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Let go -- he can't -- !

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Only half of you would get there.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Khan, you have Genesis, but you don't have me! You were going to kill me, Khan, it was your sole purpose. You'll have to come down here to do it! You'll have to come down!

Speaker: khan's voice
Dialogue: I've done far worse than kill you, Admiral. I've hurt you. And I wish to go on hurting you. I shall leave you, as you left me -- where no one will ever find you: poetic justice; marooned for eternity in the center of a dead planet -- buried alive.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Khan -- !

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Goodbye, Admiral. Oh, and don't count on Enterprise. She can't move. My next act will be to blow her out of the heavens.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: KHAN!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Warp drive still inoperative. All other systems should be restored shortly.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Excellent. We have all the time in the world.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: This is Lt. Saavik, calling Enterprise...

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: He's alive!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Pavel?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: No use, Admiral, they're still jamming all channels.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: It wouldn't make any difference. If Enterprise obeyed orders she's long since gone. And if she couldn't obey, she's finished.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: So are we, it looks like.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I don't understand. Who's responsible for all this? Who is Khan?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: It's a long story.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: We appear to have plenty of time.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: You and your father can catch up on things.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: My father. I hope you realize another man has just been killed because of...

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Because of you, son. You shouldn't have tried to rush someone holding a primed phaser. Anyway it isn't one man dead, it's two, in case you've lost count.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Do you have anything to eat? I don't know about anyone else, but I'm starved.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: How can you think of food at a time like this?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Our first order of business is survival.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: There's food in the Genesis cave, enough to last a lifetime -- should that be necessary.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: We thought this was Genesis.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: This? It took the Starfleet corps of engineers ten months in space suits to tunnel out all this. What we did in there -- we did in a day. David, why don't you show Dr. McCoy and the Lieutenant our idea of food.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: But we can't just sit here -- !

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Oh, yes we can. Is there really something to eat?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: David. Please.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Admiral?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: As your teacher Mr. Spock is fond of saying: I like to think there always are possibilities.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: David was right, wasn't he? It's just to keep them busy.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Why? Why didn't you tell me?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: How can you ask me that? Were we together? Where we going to be? You had your world and I had mine. I wanted him in mine, not chasing through the universe with his father.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: He's a lot like you in many ways. Nothing I could do about it. He's smarter, of course; that goes without saying. Most of Genesis is really his.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: This is it, isn't it? We're never going to get out of here.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Please. Tell me what you're feeling.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: There's a man I haven't seen in fifteen years who thinks he's killed me. You show me a son who'd almost be happy to help him. My son. My life that could have been and wasn't. What am I feeling? I'm feeling old -- worn out.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Let me show you something that will make you feel young -- young as when the world was new.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: He'll be all right. Come.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: You did this -- in a day?!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: The matrix formed in a day. The life forms grew later -- at a wildly accelerated rate. Can I cook or can't I?

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Impulse power restored.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: More than a match for poor Enterprise.

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Departing dark side, Regula.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Visual --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Where IS she?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: The Admiral's son.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Don't you believe it.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Oh, I believe it.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Now that's what I call a meal.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: It's like the Garden of Eden...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Only here, every apple comes from the Tree of Knowledge.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What's on your mind, Lieutenant?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: The Kobayashi Maru, sir.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: The what?

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: The no-win scenario -- and with what philosophy a commander faces defeat.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Are you asking me if we are playing out that scenario now, Lieutenant?

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: On the test, sir, will you tell me what you did? I'd really like to know.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Lieutenant, you are looking at the only Starfleet cadet who ever beat the no-win scenario --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: And almost got tossed out of the Academy...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I reprogrammed the simulation so it was possible to rescue the ship.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: WHAT?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I changed the conditions of the test. I received a commendation for original thinking.  I don't like to lose.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Then -- you never faced that situation -- faced death...

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Until now.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We each face death every day we're alive, Saavik.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock, this is Kirk. It's two hours. Are you about ready?

Speaker: spock's voice
Dialogue: Right on schedule, Admiral. Just give us your coordinates and we'll beam you aboard.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Right. I don't like to lose.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: But the damage report -- we were immobilized...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Come, come, Lieutenant, you of all people go by the book. Hello, Spock. You remember Dr. Marcus...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Certainly...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: By the book...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Regulation 46-A: 'If transmissions are being monitored during battle...'

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: '... no uncoded messages on an open channel...'

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: You lied.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I exaggerated.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hours instead of days, Saavik; now we have minutes instead of hours --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: I'm taking this bunch to sick bay.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: They're inoperative below C-deck.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What IS working around here?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Not much, Admiral. We have partial main power...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: That's it?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Best we could do in two hours.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Admiral on the bridge --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Battle stations.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Tactical.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uh oh.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: She can out-run us and out-gun us. But there is the Mutara Nebula at 153 mark four.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Scotty, can we make it inside?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: The energizer's bypassed like a Christmas tree -- so don't give me too many bumps.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: No promises, Mr. Scott. On your way.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Trouble with the nebula, sir, is all that static discharge and gas clouds our tactical display. Visuals won't function and shields will be useless.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: What's sauce for the goose, Mr. Saavik. The odds will be even.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I'm going up there.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: You'll be in the way, Dr. Marcus... best stay here.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Admiral... what happens if Reliant fails to follow us into the nebula?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I think we can guarantee she'll follow us, Mr. Saavik. Remind me to explain to you the concept of human ego.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Best speed, Scotty...

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: There! Full impulse power! Not so wounded as we were led to believe -- so much the better...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Estimating nebula penetration in two minutes. Reliant is closing.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Steady as you go...

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: We'll lose them if they go in there.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Rake her.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Take it easy --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: But I must --

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Listen to me, Pavel; you haven't the strength or the equilibrium --

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: But --

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Dr. McCoy, I can't just sit here. Tell me what I can do.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: You can help get my surgery squared away. I'm expecting customers.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: That was close --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: They just don't want us going in there.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: One minute to nebula perimeter.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Admiral, they're reducing speed.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uhura, patch me in --

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Why are we slowing?

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: We daren't follow them into the nebula, sir -- our shields will be useless...

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: This is Admiral Kirk.

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: We tried it once your way, Khan. Are you game for a rematch?

Speaker: kirk's voice
Dialogue: Khan -- ! I'm laughing at the "superior" intellect.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Full impulse power!

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: No sir! We have Genesis -- Whatever you want --

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Full power damn you!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'll say this for him: he's consistent.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: And we're... in.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Tactical!

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Inoperative.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Raise the shields...

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: As I feared, sir. Not functional. I'm reducing speed.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Phaser lock inoperative, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Best guess, Mr. Sulu. Fire when ready.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Aft-torpedoes -- fire -- !

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Hold your course. Look sharp...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: At what.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Evasive starboard!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Phaser bank one, fire!

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Joachim!

Speaker: joachim
Dialogue: Yours... is... the superior...

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: I shall avenge you --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Damage, Scotty?

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Admiral, I've got to take the mains off the line. The energizer's shaken loose and I can't get in there to fix her -- radiation --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: All right, we'll do the job with auxiliary power.

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Could you use another hand, Admiral?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Man the weapons console, Mr. Chekov.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Sporadic energy readings port side, aft. Could be an impulse turn.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: He won't break off now. If he followed me this far he'll be back. But from where...?

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: He's intelligent, but not experienced. His pattern indicates two dimensional thinking...

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Saavik, all stop.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: All stop, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Descend ten thousand meters. Stand by photon torpedoes.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: Where is he? Where in God's name is he?

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Torpedoes ready, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Fire.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Cease fire. Look sharp.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Power levels quite low, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Mr. Scott, can you get the mains back on line?

Speaker: scotty's voice
Dialogue: I'll need ten minutes, sir, 'til the radiation dissipates.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uhura, send to Commander, Reliant: prepare to be boarded.

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: uhura's voice
Dialogue: Commander, Reliant, this is Enterprise. Surrender and prepare to be boarded. Repeat...

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: No... Kirk. The game's not over.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: To the last I will grapple with thee!

Speaker: uhura
Dialogue: Enterprise to Reliant: you are ordered to surrender your vessel. Respond!  Nothing, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We'll beam aboard. Alert transporter room --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Admiral. Scanning an energy source on Reliant. A pattern I've never seen.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: It's the Genesis Wave!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: He's on a build up to detonation!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: How soon --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: We encoded four minutes --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: We'll beam aboard and stop it --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: You can't!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Scotty, I need warp speed in three minutes or we're all dead!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Scotty!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Saavik, get us out, best speed!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: khan
Dialogue: No... You can't get away... From hell's heart I stab at thee...  For hate's sake... I spit my last breath at thee!

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Are you out of your Vulcan mind? No human can tolerate the radiation loose in there!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: But, as you are so fond of observing, Doctor, I'm not human.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: You're not going in there -- !

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I'm afraid I can't stop to discuss this logically --

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Spock -- get out of there!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Time from my mark...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Two minutes, ten seconds.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engine room! What's happening?!

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: Captain, please!

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: Get out! Get out, man! Oh, dear God...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Time!

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Three minutes, thirty seconds.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Distance from Reliant...

Speaker: chekov
Dialogue: Four hundred kilometers.

Speaker: cadet
Dialogue: Sir! The mains are back on line -- !

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Bless you, Scotty. Go, Saavik!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Reduce speed. My God, Carl. Look at it.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Engine Room. Well done. Scotty?

Speaker: bones' voice
Dialogue: Jim, you'd better get down here. Hurry.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Saavik, take the con.

Speaker: scotty
Dialogue: No, sir! You'll flood the whole compartment...!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: He'll die -- !

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: He's dead already, Jim.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Oh, God.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: The ship -- out of danger?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yes --

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Don't grieve, Admiral -- it's logical: the good of the many outweighs --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: ... the good of the few...

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: Or the one.

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I never took the Kobayashi Maru test -- until now. What do you think of my solution?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Spock...!

Speaker: spock
Dialogue: I have been -- and always will be -- your friend... Live. Long. And. Prosper.

Speaker: saavik's voice
Dialogue: Admiral, you've got to see this! There's new life -- a whole new world, a Genesis world -- !

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: In accordance with the traditions of Starfleet and of Article 184 Starfleet Regulations, we are assembled here today to pay final respects to our honored dead.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: -- human.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Lieutenant Saavik.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: We commend the soul of our brother departed. We love we commit his body to the depths of space.

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Honors -- hup!

Speaker: sulu
Dialogue: Return -- hup!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Lieutenant.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: After you dismiss the company, you will take the watch. Set course for Ceti Alpha V and we'll pick up survivors.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'll be in my quarters if needed, but I would prefer...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Understood, sir.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Dismiss the company.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yes... come.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I don't mean to intrude.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Uh, no...  I should be on the bridge.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Are you running away from me?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I suppose I was.  I poured a drink. Would you like it?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: No. I -- I guess I'm not what you expected.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I didn't expect anything.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: That makes two of us.  Lieutenant Saavik was right: you never have faced death --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Not like this -- no. I haven't faced death, I cheated death. I tricked my way out of death and patted myself on the back for my ingenuity. I know nothing.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: You knew enough to tell Saavik that how we face death is at least as important as how we face life --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: It was just words.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: But good words. That's where ideas begin. Maybe you should listen to them.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I'm trying, David.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: So am I. My friends were killed, too.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: I am truly sorry.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I was wrong about you. And I'm sorry.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Is that what you came here to say?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Mainly.  And also that I'm proud -- very proud -- to be your son.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Admiral on the bridge!

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: As you were, Mr. Saavik.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aye, sir. On course to Ceti Alpha. All is well.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Good, I believe you already know my, uh, son --

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Yes, well, why don't you show him around and...

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: Aye, sir --

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: So you turn out to be the dumb bastard.

Speaker: saavik
Dialogue: That is a little joke.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: She's changed her hair again.  Will you look at that? Think they'll name it for you, Doctor?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Not if I can help it. We'll name it for our friend.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: It is a far far better thing I do than I have ever done before... a far better resting place I go to than I have ever known...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Is that a poem?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Something Spock was trying to tell me. On my birthday.

Speaker: bones
Dialogue: You okay, Jim? How do you feel?

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Young. I feel young, Doctor.

Speaker: kirk
Dialogue: Lieutenant, new course: 'Second star to the right and straight on till morning.'

Speaker: spock's voice
Dialogue: Space, the final frontier... These are the continuing voyages of the Starship Enterprise... Her ongoing mission: to explore strange new worlds... to seek out new life and new civilizations... To boldly go where no man has gone before...
